Name: Openbank
Company description: Openbank is a digital banking platform operating under the umbrella of Banco Santander, dedicated to providing innovative financial services to a diverse clientele. Established with a mission to enhance financial inclusion and simplify banking, Openbank offers a wide range of products including personal accounts, loans, investment options, and insurance solutions, all accessible through a user-friendly online interface. The bank primarily targets tech-savvy individuals and small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) who seek efficient and convenient banking solutions without the constraints of traditional banking. Openbank emphasizes a customer-centric approach, leveraging advanced technology to deliver personalized services and streamline financial management. The company's vision is to become the leading open platform for financial services, focusing on transparency, accessibility, and sustainability. Openbank collaborates with various fintech partners and financial institutions to enhance its service offerings and maintain a competitive edge in the rapidly evolving digital banking landscape. With a strong commitment to responsible banking practices, Openbank integrates environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria into its operations, ensuring alignment with sustainability goals. Openbank actively engages in community investment and social initiatives, aiming to create a positive impact in the communities it serves. The bank's target market includes individuals from various demographics, including young professionals and underserved communities, reflecting its dedication to promoting financial literacy and inclusion. By continuously evolving its offerings and prioritizing customer satisfaction, Openbank is positioned as a leader in the digital banking sector, striving to redefine the banking experience for modern consumers.

Name: Trade Republic
Company description: Trade Republic is a leading European fintech company that operates a mobile-first brokerage platform, enabling users to trade stocks, ETFs, and cryptocurrencies with zero commission fees. Through its commitment to transparency and inclusivity, Trade Republic is transforming how individuals engage with financial markets, making investing a viable option for all.

Name: Raisin
Company description: Raisin is a trailblazer for open banking in the deposits and investments space. Raisin GmbH was formed by a merger of the FinTech companies Deposit Solutions and Raisin in June 2021.   The FinTech company provides an open banking infrastructure for the global $50+ trillion deposit market that benefits banks and savers alike. For savers, it means more product choice and decision power. Customer-facing institutions like banks benefit from best-in-class savings marketplace solutions for their own customers, while deposit-taking banks receive flexible, cost-effective access to diversified deposit funding.   Raisin operates its own B2C platforms across Europe and the UK under the Raisin, WeltSparen, Savedo, and ZINSPILOT brands, and in the U.S. under the brand SaveBetter. In the U.S., Raisin also offers a patented B2B Savings as a Service software solution. In Germany, in addition to savings products for retail and corporate clients, the company also offers ETF-based investment and pension products. Raisin collaborates with ca. 400 banks and financial services providers from more than 30 countries. The company is servicing over 550,000 direct customers.   Raisin is backed by renowned international investors such as btov Ventures, Deutsche Bank, FinLab, Goldman Sachs, Greycroft, Headline/e.ventures, Index Ventures, Kinnevik, Orange Digital Ventures, PayPal Ventures, Thrive Capital, Top Tier Capital Partners, Ribbit Capital, and Vitruvian Partners, as well as Peter Thiel.   The company has offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, London, Madrid, Manchester, Milan, New York, Paris, and Zurich.

Name: Mooney
Company description: Mooney Group S.p.A. is a pioneering Italian fintech company that specializes in proximity banking, payment services, and mobility solutions. Established in 2020 through the merger of SisalPay and Banca 5, Mooney operates a vast network of over 45,000 points of sale, including newsagents, kiosks, and coffee bars, making essential financial services accessible to a diverse clientele across Italy. By prioritizing ethical practices and inclusivity within its operations, Mooney aims to create a positive social impact and contribute to the digital transformation of Italy's financial landscape.

The company focuses on compliance-driven solutions and cybersecurity, ensuring that its offerings meet the stringent regulatory requirements of the life sciences sector. Serving more than 200 clients globally, including notable organizations in Denmark, Poland, the USA, and beyond, 7N partners with industry leaders to tackle complex IT challenges, from clinical trial analytics to AI-driven research platforms. In addition to its life sciences focus, 7N also provides high-quality consulting and outsourcing services to large international industrial companies and financial institutions, including banks, asset management firms, fintechs, and insurance companies. The firm operates across multiple geographical markets, including Norway, Finland, Sweden, Switzerland, and India, catering to a diverse clientele that values high credit quality and robust service delivery. 7N's vision is to maintain a sustainable business model while focusing on continuous improvement and adaptation to market changes, ensuring long-term success for both the company and its stakeholders. The company is committed to transparency, sustainability, and ethical business practices, aligning its operations with the UN Global Compact and the Sustainable Development Goals. Through initiatives like the 7N Academy, 7N fosters a culture of continuous learning and professional development, bridging talent gaps and driving innovation in the industry. By providing skilled IT consultants and managing IT project delivery teams, 7N enhances operational efficiency and reduces risk exposure for its clients, making it a trusted partner in their digital journeys.

Name: Libertex Group

Name: MyBucks
Company description: MyBucks S.A. (WKN: A2AJLT, ISIN: LU1404975507, Ticker Symbol: MBC:GR) is a FinTech company based in Luxembourg that delivers seamless financial services through technology. Through its brands GetBucks, GetSure, New Finance Bank and Fairgo Finance, the company offers impact loans, unsecured credit, banking solutions as well as insurance products to customers.  MyBucks has experienced exponential growth since its inception in 2011 and today has operations in eleven African and one European country as well as in Australia. MyBucks aims to ensure that its product offering is accessible, simple and trustworthy, in comparison to traditional, non-technological methods, working towards enhancing the benefits to the customer. The MyBucks‚Äô product offering enables customers to manage their financial affairs easily and conveniently.

Name: Grant Thornton Sweden
Company description: Grant Thornton Sweden is a leading audit and consulting firm dedicated to supporting entrepreneurial companies in navigating the complexities of the financial landscape. With a mission to foster sustainable growth, the firm emphasizes a holistic approach that integrates economic, environmental, and social considerations into its services. Grant Thornton offers a comprehensive range of expertise, including auditing, tax advisory, and consultancy, with a particular focus on clients in the financial services sector, such as banks, insurance companies, and fintech firms. The company prides itself on its customer-oriented approach, leveraging a global network to provide tailored solutions that enhance clients' credibility and competitiveness. Serving approximately 17,000 companies, Grant Thornton focuses on mid-market businesses, aiming to be a leader in the industry by helping clients future-proof their operations against evolving challenges and regulatory requirements. With a workforce of over 1,400 employees, the firm fosters a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and sustainability, striving to create a positive impact on both its clients and the broader business community. The firm is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within its workforce, prioritizing employee well-being and ethical business practices. As a member of Grant Thornton International Ltd., the company benefits from a global network that enhances its ability to serve clients effectively. The firm emphasizes corporate governance and risk management, ensuring transparency and ethical practices in all its operations. By delivering insightful and pragmatic solutions, Grant Thornton Sweden empowers clients to achieve their business objectives and thrive in an ever-evolving market. With a strong focus on collaboration and integration across its various service lines, the firm provides personalized attention and strategic insights to a diverse clientele, including owner-managed businesses, multinational corporations, and public sector entities.

Name: Bank Frick
Company description: Bank Frick specialises in banking for intermediaries. We provide a fully integrated offering of classic banking and blockchain banking services. Our clients include fintechs, asset managers, payment service providers, family offices, fund promoters, pension funds and fiduciaries. Name: KfW Capital
Company description: KfW Capital, a wholly-owned subsidiary of KfW Bankengruppe, was established in 2018 with the mission of enhancing the venture capital (VC) ecosystem in Germany and Europe. The company focuses on investing in German and European venture capital and venture debt funds, aiming to improve access to growth capital for innovative, technology-oriented startups and growth companies. KfW Capital is committed to sustainability, integrating environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria into its investment processes, and aligning its efforts with the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals. Through initiatives like the ERP Special Fund, the Future Fund, and the Green Transition Facility, KfW Capital mobilizes private capital alongside public funding to support economic development and foster a sustainable future. The company collaborates with a diverse range of clients, including institutional investors such as insurance companies and family offices, as well as venture capital funds and startups. KfW Capital has committed over EUR 2.3 billion to support more than 2,200 startups, reflecting its dedication to fostering innovation and sustainable development. Its portfolio includes 112 VC funds that have collectively invested in over 2,000 portfolio companies, emphasizing the importance of competitiveness, innovation, and digital transformation. KfW Capital also prioritizes diversity and inclusion within its workforce and investment strategies, recognizing the value of varied perspectives in driving success. By promoting transparency and data availability within the VC ecosystem, KfW Capital aims to create a positive impact on the economy and society while achieving attractive returns for its investors. Through its strategic partnerships and commitment to responsible investing, KfW Capital is positioned as a leading venture capital investor, dedicated to empowering entrepreneurs and driving technological advancements across various sectors, including fintech, healthcare, and climate technology.

Name: Cash Credit
Company description: Cash Credit is an innovative FinTech company offering micro-finance services in cooperation with mobile telecom operators and other partners. The company was founded in 2011 in Bulgaria and has expanded internationally, launching operations in Africa, and South-East Asia, and exploring opportunities in other markets around the world. Proprietary, innovative and automated credit scoring process based on analysis of mobile operators‚Äô and other partners‚Äô big data, unique technical solutions, and rapid credit decisions are some of the key pillars of Cash Credit unique offering. At the end of 2013 Cash Credit Group received international recognition for its innovative model and raised 25 million U.S. dollar financing from Delta Partners Capital Limited. The company has strategic partnerships with MTN Group in Africa and Voyager Innovation, the digital financial and commerce arm of Smart Communications, in the Philippines. Cash Credit‚Äôs pioneering expertise in aggregating, analyzing and applying data is used there to offer innovative financial services. Headquartered in Regensburg, Germany, intive is present across Europe, Asia and the Americas, with a diverse team of +2,000 people.

Name: AMBAR SOLUCIONES SA

Name: AvaFin
Company description: AvaFin is an international fintech group founded in 2012, with over 400 employees worldwide.  We offer innovative consumer loans to help customers meet their financial needs with ease and convenience. Our services are available in five key markets: Poland, Spain, Mexico, Czechia, and Latvia.  Leveraging advanced technology and data science, we continuously adapt to our customers‚Äô evolving needs, providing fair and transparent products. This partnership supports Capitec's international expansion while strengthening AvaFin's ability to provide accessible, affordable financial services to customers worldwide.

Name: Solaris SE
Company description: Solaris SE is a leading embedded finance platform headquartered in Berlin, specializing in Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) solutions that provide regulated banking products to a diverse range of external partners, including large corporations, banks, and fintech companies. The company's mission is to empower the future of financial services by enabling partners to seamlessly integrate digital banking services into their offerings, which encompass a wide array of financial products such as loans, payments, and digital accounts. Solaris SE is committed to sustainability, guided by its Nature, People, Business (NPB) strategy, which emphasizes environmental responsibility, social equity, and business resilience. With a workforce of over 700 employees from more than 70 nationalities, Solaris fosters a culture of diversity and inclusion, aiming for a minimum of 30% women representation across all job levels by 2025. The company actively collaborates with partners and investors to promote sustainable finance and is dedicated to achieving net-zero emissions by 2030. Solaris SE adheres to high ethical standards and human rights principles, as outlined in its regularly updated Organization Handbook, ensuring compliance with the German Banking Act. The company primarily serves clients in the financial services sector across the European Union and the UK, leveraging its robust technology infrastructure and API capabilities to enhance the embedded finance industry. Solaris SE's strategic partnerships, including its acquisition of Contis Group Limited, enable it to deliver innovative and scalable financial solutions that adapt to changing market demands. The company is focused on operational risk management, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards while fostering a strong risk culture. Solaris SE is dedicated to transparency and accountability, adhering to the GRI Universal Standards for sustainability reporting. It emphasizes the importance of integrating risk management into its overall banking governance and is committed to creating a supportive work environment that promotes continuous learning and growth for its employees. As a forward-thinking financial technology company, Solaris SE is well-positioned to capitalize on emerging market trends and deliver value to its partners and customers, particularly in sectors such as mobility, technology, and hospitality.

Name: Bitpanda Technology Solutions

While our roots are in crypto, we‚Äôve always been a technology-first company, developing innovative infrastructure to simplify wealth creation. Our modular and scalable Investment-as-a-Service (IaaS) platform and Custody Solution empowers financial institutions, fintechs and platforms to integrate comprehensive offerings through APIs. From savings plans and crypto staking to fractional stocks/ETFs, asset-to-asset swaps, and secure custody for digital assets, we provide everything needed to expand into new markets and offer cutting-edge solutions to end users. Supported by Bitpanda‚Äôs extensive licenses, our solutions are designed to meet the highest standards of security, compliance and scalability, whether in Europe or worldwide. We believe the future of finance is collaborative. That‚Äôs why we partner with banks and financial institutions to reshape the investment landscape, placing our partners at the center of this evolution. Our White-Label API and Custody Solution have already attracted leading fintechs and platforms, helping them serve over 20 million users across 25+ countries. Stay tuned for updates on our product innovations, industry insights and how we‚Äôre building a more inclusive, innovative, and sustainable future for investing‚Äîtogether.

Name: Inpay

Through strategic partnerships and a customer-centric approach, Inpay strives to create a positive societal impact while maintaining high standards of ethical conduct and compliance. With plans for significant geographical expansion and tailored solutions for its key verticals, Inpay is well-positioned for continued growth and innovation in the payments landscape.

The company is dedicated to empowering its clients by delivering accessible financial solutions that support their growth and stability, particularly focusing on small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and individual borrowers. With a mission to enhance the accessibility of credit while maintaining a strong emphasis on responsible lending practices, Nordiska aims to build long-term relationships with its clients. The company collaborates with various fintech companies and financial institutions to optimize its service offerings, ensuring a robust and competitive presence in the financial landscape across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, and the Netherlands. Nordiska's vision includes becoming a leading player in the digital transformation of the financial services industry, continuously improving its services to meet the evolving demands of its target market. Nordiska is committed to maintaining high standards of transparency and ethical governance, ensuring that all lending activities are conducted with meticulous credit risk management and regulatory compliance. The company also focuses on expanding its income streams by venturing into leasing and other financial services, thereby reducing reliance on net interest income. By fostering strategic partnerships and actively seeking acquisition opportunities, Nordiska aims to enhance its market presence and service offerings, ultimately driving sustainable growth and profitability.

Name: Paynetics
Company description: Paynetics is a leader in B2B payments and a digital banking platform provider. We are on a mission to simplify payments. We are pioneering a new type of FinTech company ‚Äì we work to be Europe‚Äôs leading "regulated fintech" ‚Äì combining the trust that comes from being an e-money institution and principal member of Mastercard, VISA, SWIFT and SEPA with the digital DNA and innovation of a fintech. We work with our partners to implement any of these services as ‚Äúpoint solutions‚Äù. But the real benefit of working with Paynetics comes from working with us across a range of services to greatly improve implementation time for you, and time to cash for your customers.  We have a team of payment experts who helped introduce ATMs and chip cards to entire nations and re-established financial systems of whole countries. Whatever your payments challenge, we can help you meet it. We offer payments, simplified.

Freebee brings together hundreds of individual loyalty programs under one roof and in doing so, aggregates invaluable transactional data (who, when, where, what, and for how much) providing it with actionable insights on shopper preferences across a broad range of merchant categories. Freebee today boasts an active user base in the hundreds of thousands and has led a wide variety of large scale loyalty projects involving the biggest companies in Poland such as Polkomtel, Orlen, Eurocash, AXA. YAPU Solutions primarily promotes and enables efficient management of: - sustainable agricultural finance - clean energy and anergy efficiency finance - risk transfer mechanisms - inclusion of sustainability, climate and ecosystem indicators into day-to-day operations We work with local partners in countries of operations and encourage contacts of potential partners on an ongoing basis.

Through its strategic plan "Smart 2025," ConfidiSystema! aims to expand its territorial presence and strengthen its internal commercial network while embracing digitalization and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) principles. By prioritizing client relationships and offering a comprehensive range of services, ConfidiSystema! strives to empower businesses to navigate financial challenges and seize growth opportunities effectively. The organization is dedicated to maintaining high standards of financial stability and compliance, ensuring that it meets regulatory requirements while fostering sustainable growth for its members. Ultimately, ConfidiSystema! aims to be a trusted ally for SMEs, contributing to economic resilience and development in the regions it serves.

Name: Payever
Company description: payever is a fintech headquartered in Hamburg. Founded 2013 with the aim to establish a commerce platform for merchants of any size and industry, payever offers a continuously expanding range of Payment & Checkout Solutions for both eCommerce & the Point of Sale. Through its unique platform, payever also provides additional tools and Value-Added Services. Over 5,000 merchants in 9 countries (from SMBs to big international retailers/brands like MediaMarkt, Cyberport & 1Komma5) as well as major partners like Santander, Openbank and Allianz Trade trust in payever. With its modern payment API and multiple plugins for popular eCommerce platforms such as Shopify, WooCommerce, Magento, Shopware or Commercetools as well as other features like Pay by Link, thousands of merchants utilize payever's Checkout Solutions. These include Sales Finance/Lending, B2C/B2B Buy Now Pay Later option as well as direct bank transfer based on Open Banking with support of environmental projects. Acquiring/Card and Digital Wallets complete payever's payment portfolio. BNPL/Lending can be offered as a stand-alone solution in brick-and-mortar retail (Merchant Portal) as well as through QR, SMS and Email (Self-Checkout), or integrated into the merchant's existing systems via API. A completely paperless Lending product allows customers to complete the process fully digital with OCR technology and e-signing, even without any assistance from sales personnel. Value-Added Services include an AI-powered PIM through the aforementioned integrations/plugins to alternative sales channels such as Amazon, eBay, or Meta as well as an own No Code Builder (Selling Solutions). Within the Communication Solutions, merchants can add a live chat on the website and chat with their customers through apps like WhatsApp or Messenger, enabling direct sales. Further integrations with social media such as Facebook or Instagram, allow merchants to promote products and enable a one-click checkout (Marketing Solutions).

Name: Huddlestock
Company description: Huddlestock Fintech AS is a pioneering technology provider based in Stavanger, Norway, specializing in Investment as a Service (IaaS) solutions tailored for the wealth management industry. Founded in 2014, Huddlestock made history as Norway's first publicly traded fintech company and has since expanded its capabilities through strategic acquisitions. The company's mission is to democratize access to capital markets by offering low-cost, efficient trading and investment services, thereby promoting financial inclusion. Huddlestock collaborates closely with a diverse range of clients, including neobanks, fintech startups, and established financial institutions, providing them with customizable, reliable, and innovative solutions tailored to their unique needs. The company focuses on digitizing work processes for custody banks, asset managers, and trading venues through its open, compliance-optimized wealthtech platform, which facilitates end-to-end digital services such as onboarding, client communication, and portfolio management. Huddlestock aims to enhance efficiency and reduce costs for its clients by delivering a differentiated real-time product that integrates various financial services. Its clientele spans across Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Germany, and the UK, and the company has established partnerships with notable firms in the financial sector. With a strong emphasis on research and development, Huddlestock is committed to continuous innovation, ensuring that its clients can adapt to evolving market trends and consumer needs. The company also offers consultancy services to support clients in optimizing their operations and investment solutions. As a publicly traded entity, Huddlestock is regulated by financial authorities in Norway and Germany, underscoring its dedication to compliance and operational excellence. Through its commitment to flexibility and collaboration, Huddlestock empowers businesses to deliver modern investment experiences while navigating the challenges of the rapidly evolving financial landscape.

Name: Sofie | Financieel Gezonder
Company description: Sofie is persoonlijk en draait om jou. Dat is ook de ervaring van medewerkers: "Je kijkt naar een manier die bij jou past, en die is misschien anders dan bij je buurman. Mensen die minder tevreden waren over hun geldzaken deden dit vaker.  ‚úÖ De maandelijkse mails rond salarisdatum en de extra mails voor mensen in loondienst werden buitengewoon goed geopend met een gemiddelde over 16 mails van 45%. Wij ondersteunen werkgevers met een financieel vitaliteitspakket, preventie en nazorg voor medewerkers met schulden en loonbeslag, een positieve aanpak voor young professionals om ze te helpen met persoonlijke financi√´n en studieschuld en activatie rondom het nieuwe pensioenakkoord.  We zetten FinTech in om mensen financi√´le rust en ruimte te geven en te activeren om groener te leven. Wij bouwen hiervoor een modulair SaaS-platform dat ge√Øntegreerd of gepersonaliseerd met behulp van onze app ingezet kan worden. Wij zijn uniek in onze activatie-aanpak gebaseerd op gedragsinterventies vanuit behavourial economics. Wij ondersteunen financi√´le instellingen, vaste lastenleveranciers, overheid en bedrijven met preventie en nazorg rond betalingsproblemen en activatie bij persoonlijke financi√´n en verduurzamen.

Name: StablR
Company description: StablR stands at the forefront of fintech innovation, pioneering the integration of traditional financial stability with the transformative potential of blockchain technology. Central to our mission are the EURR, a Euro-backed stablecoin, and the StablR USD (USDR), backed by the US Dollar, both designed to bridge the gap between conventional finance and the burgeoning digital economy. With a steadfast commitment to security, compliance, and transparency, StablR offers a suite of services tailored for institutions and individuals navigating the Web 3.0 landscape. Our offerings extend beyond mere transactions, encompassing yield generation, seamless fiat-to-crypto conversions, and comprehensive KYB protocols, all underpinned by a multichain infrastructure that ensures interoperability and frictionless exchanges across diverse blockchain ecosystems. As Europe steps into a new era of financial regulations with the advent of MiCA, StablR is positioned as a beacon for those seeking a compliant, stable, and reliable Electronic Money Token, like StablR's Stablecoins EURR and USDR; both backed 1:1 by their respective fiat currencies with an independently audited Proof-of-Reserve that is updated in near-real time.  Our vision is a decentralised financial domain where transactions are not just secure, but inherently stable, fostering an environment ripe for innovation, growth, and unparalleled financial freedom.

Name: KLINX
Company description: Artificial intelligence has been experiencing a new spring in the last decade. Workgroup Consulting, a Milan company active since 2000 that produces software for the banking and insurance sector, has been investing in this branch of information technology for some years. "Our research and development activities on A.I. - says Mario Farris, president of Workgroup - took off with the constitution of the fintech startup K Linx, whose mission is to reconcile cash flows from unstructured payments in a simplified and innovative way. In this regard, we have adopted "cognitive computing", the development of appropriately trained artificial neural networks which in this case of use automate the verification and payment-invoice reconciliation ". The skills in A.I. matured in K Linx, went back to Workgroup which set up a team shared with the one of the startup in order to make use of these skills in further smart tools - among the latest born is K Word, an information extraction solution based on NER-class ANN - and above all, to offer customers this valuable experience by making it available in projects where modeling and training artificial intelligence is required. Born as a consulting company, Workgroup has evolved into a Technology Provider and incubator of smart tools, suitable to being conveyed through new startups. K LINX it is a fintech startup company, owned by Workgroup, that performs payment matching and reconciliation. The greatest added value concerns unstructured payments as Sepa Credit Transfer, SWIFT etc. where main  reconciliation infos are drowned in free text fields. Name: Better Payment Germany GmbH

We make online payments simple and enable our clients to grow their business. We do so by offering the most important payment methods for Online & Offline in one solution. Name: Ibancar World
Company description: Ibancar is a fintech company disrupting asset based lending in Spain and launching in Latin America.  It is the only company in the world operating a 100% remote and truly frictionless asset based lending model using the borrower's car as collateral. Requiring no contact with the borrower or the car, Ibancar makes loans available within hours. Its creative and disciplined business model is purpose built for online distribution and massively scalable. Ibancars intelligent and innovative approach is a game changer for online lending.  The use of collateral makes every applicant more creditworthy allowing Ibancar to lend larger amounts for longer periods to first time borrowers without the high losses incurred by other online lenders. This approach to lending gives Ibancar a huge competitive advantage generating a sector leading client lifetime value.  Ibancar operates a sustainable platform offering ethical and well understood loans that are genuinely inclusive and have appeal across the entire credit spectrum as well as enabling the credit invisible and, with this sensible approach to risk, Ibancar is making payday lending a thing of the past.

Name: Hong Kong Chamber Of Commerce In Sweden
Company description: The Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce in Sweden is an independent, non-political and non-profit organization. The mission of the Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce in Sweden is to promote business relations between Sweden and Hong Kong and act as a catalyst for projects between the two regions.  With an already rich history of collaboration and cooperation between the two regions, we are looking to build on this and offer even more dynamic cross-regional opportunities.  Through seminars, events, and networking activities, we will promote more comprehensive member engagement in business, research and education. We also arrange delegation visits to Hong Kong, to see first-hand how crucial the city is as a gateway to east Asia.  Beyond this, we will also focus on students and startups, acting as catalyst for their future international endeavours and as a touchpoint for exploring Hong Kong and Asian opportunities.  As Sweden is starting to become a dominant force in industries such as design, fintech, sustainability, and gaming, we seek to promote extending the reach of these fields, especially as far as Hong Kong partnerships and interactions are concerned.  Additionally, through the close cooperation between companies and organisations in Sweden and Hong Kong, we are able to offer an experienced network that will benefit all members in meaningful ways.  We belong to the Federation of Hong Kong Business Associations Worldwide, a business network of more than 41 Hong Kong Associations in 30 countries and with a total of over 13 000 individual members. The Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce has its registered seat and head office in Stockholm. We also have regional chapters in Malm√∂/Lund, Ume√• and √ñrebro. The Chamber was established in March 2017 through a transformation of the Royal Sweden Hong Kong Society which was founded in 1984.  HRH Princess Birgitta is the Chamber‚Äôs official patron.

What we do:  1) We bring the booming asset class of music rights & song catalogs to retail investors: Global Rockstar provides an investment platform for retail investors to buy and trade shares in music rights with crisis-resistant yields. Name: Kumo
Company description: Kumo is at the forefront of the climate fintech revolution, creating software infrastructure that enables debt financing for the carbon removal market. Unlike traditional equity-based funding, our approach leverages the vast potential of the debt market to scale carbon removal projects to the levels necessary for significant environmental impact.  By integrating legal frameworks with cutting-edge technology, Kumo facilitates the flow of institutional capital into climate action, ensuring that carbon finance becomes a lucrative and risk-managed business.  Kumo facilitated the first-ever carbon-backed loan as a proof of concept with the leading European bank ABN AMRO in Q4 2023. By utilizing tokenization and smart contracts to collateralize carbon credits, we successfully channeled critical funding to Vlinder, a mangrove project developer. This demonstrated how collateralizing carbon credits to secure loans has the potential to significantly reduce financial risks and lower costs associated with financing climate projects. Name: OSMOS

Between 2019 and 2022, OSMOS implemented the Digital Explorers project with partners from the public and private sectors. This first-of-its-kind partnership project between Lithuania and Nigeria provided training and career advancement opportunities for 30 young Nigerian IT talents in 13 Lithuanian ICT companies, created ‚Ç¨2.5 million of added value for the Lithuanian ICT sector, stimulated direct Lithuanian investment in Nigeria, and opened up opportunities for cooperation between Lithuania and Nigeria in FinTech.  In 2021, Digital Explorers was recognised by the European Commission as a European success story in talent partnerships, while addressing digital transformation, migration, sustainable growth and jobs priorities of the renewed EU-Africa partnership agenda.  After the first phase of Digital Explorers, the project is being further developed to include new partner countries (Kenya, Armenia, Iraq) and to share experiences with other Baltic States (Latvia and Estonia). OSMOS is a team of reflective practitioners that also delivers in-depth analysis and presents research at international academic conferences on topics such as African narratives of Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine or EU talent partnership policy from the Baltic perspective. To facilitate more informed Africa policies in the Baltics, in partnership with ECDPM and Vilnius University, OSMOS hosts the Baltic-Africa Academy - an intensive annual thematic course for Africa foreign policy stakeholders in the Baltics.

Name: Liquid Labs GmbH
Company description: Start-Up Laboratory We've made a very clear choice to neither be a venture capital fund, nor incubator or accelerator. It was a clear choice right from the start to combine our venture capital with our entrepreneurial experience. We wanted to be hands-on when it came to our investments. As VC's, we were sparring partners and investors, but many times too far away from the day-to-day in order to be sufficiently helpful. After years of seeing best practice at work as part of our previous roles, we wanted to dive in and build companies that we're passionate about from the bottom up. Focus We focus on two segments at this time: FinTech and Logistics. In both segments we build digital products and offer services accessible online. It remains essential that we can quickly prototype and test products as well as achieve product / market fit in the near term. Immediate Path to Market We don't just think about products and prepare slide presentations. We build products and services and scale companies around them. Our investor is a large financial services company with years of success and vision for tomorrow. It gives us access to know-how, marketing channels, capital and a constant feedback loop which is critical for success. If our product can't quickly stand on its own legs, we'll move on to the next challenge.

Name: Global Thinking Foundation ETS - Non Profit Philanthropic Foundation
Company description: Global Thinking Foundation ETS promotes financial and digital education to prevent economic violence and financial abuse, targeting families, women and students. Operational offices are active in Italy (Milan, Turin, Rome, Lecce, Palermo), France (Paris) and Belgium (Brussels). GLT Foundation is an affiliate member of the OECD International Network for Financial Education and participates in the IMF/WB civil society tables. It collaborates with AssioForex and AssoFintech and integrates the Think Tank EmpowerYourLife and the Observatory on Fintech for Sustainability, promoting the dissemination of STEM skills. Its educational programmes include ‚ÄòWomen at Square‚Äô for adults, the ‚ÄòAware and Independent‚Äô app, the GLT Safe&Sound portal for cybersecurity, and the FamilyMI digital platform for families. The 2025 ‚ÄòFree to...LIVE‚Äô and ‚ÄòAddictions: No, Thank You!‚Äô tours promote awareness about economic violence and addictions without substance. Awards: 2025 Foggia Film Festival Documentary Award 2025 Italian Union of Sports Press 2024 Medaglia D'Oro Presedenza della Repubblica EA'24 2022 Ariano Irpino International Film Festival

Name: Askwallet.io
Company description: Askwallet was created by a passionate team of professionals in the fintech industry during the COVID-19 lockdown. It‚Äôs a fact that the pandemic increased the volume of new customers in electronic money institutions. They are constantly facing lack of information, hidden fees and even frauds. It leads to losing time, money and trust. We were struggling with the same problems and were asking the same questions ‚Äî and got no answers. It was quite difficult and tricky to find real reviews and real users to understand the actual situation with electronic money companies. Even harder it was to get feedback from some companies and get help with questions or issues with e-wallet or e-money accounts. We have created an innovative rating platform that helps people to find a solution for their finances and influence on companys‚Äô services. Askwalet service is a true and transparent rating with reviews based on real experience to protect people's money while they are using electronic money services. We give everyone a voice. We do not moderate reviews, so users may share their real experience whether it is negative or positive. We accept only real people and industry experts reviews and appreciate every shared story. We truly believe that our platform will provide an unique opportunity to influence financial service providers that are operating with your money. We want you to be sure that you are making the right choice and can entrust your money to an electronic money company on the Internet. Join our community today!

Name: Topi
Company description: Topi is a Berlin-based fintech company founded in 2021 by Charlotte Pallua and Estelle Merle, specializing in revolutionizing the procurement of IT hardware through a subscription-based rental model. The company aims to simplify access to essential technology for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) by allowing them to rent devices such as laptops, tablets, and smartphones instead of making outright purchases. Topi's mission is to enhance liquidity and streamline the procurement process, while also promoting sustainability through a circular economy approach, ensuring that used devices are properly recycled or repurposed.  By partnering with leading IT retailers and manufacturers, including Cyberport and Lenovo, Topi provides a seamless integration of its services into various sales channels, making it easier for businesses to access the latest technology. The company is dedicated to democratizing access to technology for SMEs, facilitating a shift towards a more sustainable model in the B2B hardware market. With significant backing from investors like Index Ventures and Creandum, Topi is well-positioned to become a key player in the European Hardware-as-a-Service market. Topi's innovative infrastructure allows retailers and manufacturers to offer hardware subscriptions to business customers, optimizing cash flow and eliminating the burden of large upfront costs. The company focuses on customer satisfaction and integrity, striving to reshape the future of B2B hardware subscriptions. By addressing the evolving needs of its clients, Topi is committed to leading the charge in transforming how businesses acquire and manage their IT resources.

Name: Infinipi
Company description: About Infinipi Open Banking "Made in Sweden"! The business idea is simple - We offer APIs in Fintech easily and cheaply!. Infinipi has the Financial Supervisory Authority's permission to act as a third-party provider (TPP) according to the EU's second payment directive (PSD2), i.e. the Payment Initiation (PIS) and Account Information Services (AIS) services. This means that you can potentially reach all banks within the EU via us. Infinipi is owned by Jonas Nygren and Fredrik Kilenius, perhaps best known from IT Provider Ventures and Lessmore. Development and support takes place in Sweden in Swedish. Lean and mean - Low prices! Within the EU, PSD2 is the most common standard for Open Banking, which i.a. means that all citizens of the EU have the right to decide who should be able to see all transactions on their account or to initiate a payment. The bank may not charge any extra fee for it. The problem is that it is expensive and takes time to build systems that connect to the banks - We have solved it for you! Use a ready-made Solution with In Frame and you can be up and running the same day. Everyone knows what that means - Low costs! A Solution consists of a product that completes a transaction or account information and/or processes the information in the desired manner. and thus constitute a complete solution for a customer or an industry. Name: Ocean Credit IFN
Company description: Ocean Credit was founded in 2015 as an IFN with a strong technology component and a desire to change the Romanians‚Äô perception regarding classic lending institutions. We are among the pioneers of digital lending in Romania, the first to bring card2card credit transfer technology to the local market, automating the entire lending process, from a KYC (know your customer) based on Facebook account, to instant money transfer on the salary card, as well as being the first to offer free online access to FICO score. Our mission is to transform complex financial information into simple data that can help people save money and time when they borrow. Time and experience are the decisive factors that differentiate a Fintech from a Bank. Users can access a loan in less than 8 minutes, thanks to 3 main services: risk management based on machine learning, instant money transfer card2card, and FICO score analytics. Ocean Credit products are simple and easy to understand, presented under friendly names like Pinguin with a limit of 4.500 lei, the Delfin credit line up to 9.000 lei, and Coral with a limit of 12.000 lei accessible exclusively online, 24/7. To this date, Ocean Credit has provided loans worth over 9 million euros out of more than 43,000 contracts.

Name: FG Lawyers
Company description: FG Lawyers is a boutique law firm based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, founded by experienced lawyers stemming from one of the biggest Dutch independent law firms. We assist financial undertakings as well as FinTech companies in qualifying their contemplated business, products or services under the existing regulatory framework. Naturally, we also assist our clients in the subsequent processes with the Dutch financial regulators in relation to scope requests, regulatory sandbox admission requests (to the extent available), registrations, license applications and other ways of enabling our clients to launch its business in the Netherlands in accordance with the regulatory laws and regulations. We find joy in facilitating all sorts of clients in this fascinating interplay of financial regulation, law and business strategies.   We are a specialist firm without any fuss or strings attached: the interest of our client is our priority and we assist our clients in achieving an optimal legal solution. In doing so we offer reasonable fees and a flexible fee structure. Solution driven, inventive, open-minded, personal and high quality: that is what we stand for.

Name: North Channel Bank GmbH & Co. KG
Company description: North Channel Bank GmbH & Co. KG is an independent specialized bank located in Mainz. It offers future-oriented and intelligent credit and capital market solutions as well as consulting services in US Life Settlements financing, investments, structured finance, and digital banking services. Founded as the privately owned Bankhaus Oswald Kruber in Berlin in 1924, the bank changed its name in 2009 after it was acquired by a North American investor group. Since then, one focus has been on the financing of US Life Settlements. In recent years, North Channel Bank has developed into an innovative merchant bank that concentrates on various niche topics and supports small and medium-sized businesses in the medium and small project segment. In structured finance, the bank concentrates on financing in the renewable energy sector, capital goods financing, and growth financing. Digital business models are another focus. In case of Impact finance projects, the bank questions not only their feasibility in a market economy but also their social relevance. For many years, the bank has been working with the renowned US servicer NorthStar Life Services, LLC, and since 2020 also with NorthStar Life Settlements Trading, LLC, to invest in and finance US Life Settlements. In the digital banking segment, the bank offers its services as a partner for Fintechs. This ranges from support as a fronting bank for intermediary portals to banking services for Fintechs. The bank is also a reliable partner in asset management. Imprint: https://www.northchannelbank.de/en/legal-navigation/imprint/

Name: Global Coalition To Fight Financial Crime
Company description: The Coalition was founded by key public and private stakeholders in the fight against financial crime and seeks to achieve its overarching purpose of mitigating financial crime by identifying key weaknesses in the current system, advocating for tangible reforms at political and policy level, and make the global anti-money laundering framework more effective. The main objectives of the Coalition are to: ‚Ä¢	Raise global awareness of financial crime as a critical challenge with grave financial and human consequences ‚Ä¢	Promote more effective information sharing between public and private entities ‚Ä¢	Propose mechanisms to identify emerging threats and best practice approaches to more robust controls against money laundering ‚Ä¢	Identify pressure points in the current anti-money laundering/counter-terrorist framework and propose solutions to these Representing different parts of the anti-financial crime ecosystem, the Coalition has the expertise to blend best-in-class approaches to financial crime management, risk intelligence, law enforcement capabilities, public-private information sharing and thought leadership on financial crime prevention. Name: Secrets Vault
Company description: Secrets Vault has invented a patented method that turns ordinary images into post-quantum cryptographic keys. This makes authentication and data protection simple and secure without passwords, hardware tokens, or complex user flows. Keys are generated locally on the user‚Äôs device from unmodified images, so nothing sensitive is stored or transmitted. The result: strong privacy, resistance to phishing and brute-force attacks, and long-term security even in the era of AI and quantum computing. With decades of expertise in cryptography and cybersecurity, our team makes advanced protection easy to integrate into existing IAM systems or deploy as a standalone solution. Secrets Vault brings security that is private, robust, and built to last. The first product leveraging our SDK is an innovative solution designed to safeguard information (the "secret") in a highly secure and user-friendly way by using images that can be openly displayed and shared. Our patented cryptographic protocol can solve numerous challenges in data storage, cybersecurity, and blockchain. Our team comprises seasoned experts with a proven track record of deploying innovative solutions across various sectors. By utilizing advanced cryptography, we have addressed complex challenges in iGaming, Internet Voting, electronic ID, Fintech, and cybersecurity.

Name: Portugal Fintech
Company description: We are a FinTech-centric network. We are committed to exponentially rising the potential of the Portuguese scenario as a FinTech venture hub and to creating a united ecosystem where every FinTech, InsureTech, RegTech and Cybersecurity company in Portugal can constantly interact with regulators, legislators, consultants, banks, investors and other relevant entities. We are currently witnessing a global shift favorable to the development of these startups, in which some of the key trends are impossible to ignore: -   Consumers are more demanding about the quality of the products, ease of¬† use and the context where they       appear; -   The regulators' focus on consumer-centric policies; -   The profitability issues faced by a significant part of the sector that creates pressure to reduce cost while       increasing revenues; -   Technological advancement for traditional institutions provoked by regulatory scenario (e.g. PSD2, GDPR, MIFID       II, IFRS); -   Opening the banking and financial sectors to new players and disruptors. We strongly believe FinTech, InsurTech and RegTech startups have a fundamental role in this shift - both as a catalyzer and as a continuous developer - and only through a close collaboration with incumbents and regulators will it be possible to unlock their full potential. Portugal FinTech has the core objective of creating a favorable environment for this connection to happen by: ¬† -   Enabling banks and insurance companies to have common ground for dialogue about potential collaborations       with startups and their benefits; -   Collaborating with regulatory agencies and legislators to help create an easier, faster and clearer environment for       innovation; -   Supporting the international growth of startups through the network's partnerships.

Name: Supergrads
Company description: Supergrads is a bespoke recruitment firm that provides clients in the Trading, Commodity, Energy, and Utility Industries with exceptional, well-educated STEM candidates from juniors up to CxO level. Supergrads‚Äô mission is to deliver best-in-class recruitment. In today‚Äôs modern world, clients face obscure challenges when looking for the ideal candidate. Supergrads overcomes these challenges by delivering the best and nothing but the best in the candidate selection for clients.  Supergrads was founded in 2021 by Rogier Elsenburg. As a former derivatives trader, he started in Executive Search and Recruitment for Huxley in 2003, earning his stripes in the European Banking & Financial Markets space and progressing to the SThree Benelux & France board. He was responsible for the opening and growth of the Huxley Frankfurt & Paris offices whilst simultaneously founding and managing the local Amsterdam Banking and Financial Markets teams. His expertise in various, international recruitment domains is visible in the over 550 successful placements of Software Engineers, Quants, Traders, Risk Managers, and other STEM-educated professionals into the Commodity, Energy, Utilities, and Trading Industry under his supervision. In his 20 years of experience, he accomplished many Search, and Interim assignments alongside multiple executive-level placements and has been managing a group of 250+ Interim IT & Finance professionals. As the successes show, Elsenburg has an extensive network in the Global Financial hubs and is able to deliver five legged sheep. After leaving the SThree group, he successfully co-founded LIFT International, a specialist FinTech, Banking Technology, and Quantitative Finance staffing solutions firm, in October 2017. After four successful years, LIFT International was acquired in March 2021, allowing him to start a new project he feels deeply passionate about: Supergrads.

Name: Topos Network
Company description: Topos is a fintech infrastructure platform that transforms cross-border support into productive financial assets. By linking remittances and diaspora pledges to local credit, Topos enables affordable lending, deeper financial inclusion, and new pathways for economic growth in frontier markets. Every year, families and communities move trillions of dollars across borders through remittances and informal support networks. These flows represent trust and resilience, but rarely build long-term credit history or access to formal finance. Topos changes that. Our platform provides the technology and compliance rails for local financial institutions to originate loans that are backed by remittance flows or diaspora pledges. Borrowers gain access to credit in their home market; pledgers abroad can provide support securely; and partner institutions gain new, low-risk lending opportunities. By bridging trusted community finance with modern digital infrastructure, Topos is building a verifiable financial history for underserved populations, helping them step into the formal economy while giving institutions new ways to lend sustainably.

Name: Kontomatik
Company description: Kontomatik is a Poland-based fintech company, which has been providing banking data aggregation services since 2009 ‚Äì long before ‚Äúopen banking‚Äù became a commonly accepted term. At the beginning, Kontomatik developed a personal finance management platform, but in 2021 that portal was sold in order to continue developing B2B services based on open banking and financial data analysis.   Their products are based on automatic financial data gathering via PSD2 APIs from banks in Poland and Europe. The primary service Kontomatik offers is customer bank account access (AIS), which allows a company to receive data from a customer‚Äôs bank account, with their consent. AIS is regulated by the PSD2 directive, passed in 2019, which requires banks to provide account information to authorized companies upon the user‚Äôs request.    Kontomatik was the first company in the CEE region to become an authorized AISP (Account Information Service Provider) when it received an entry in the registers of the Polish Financial Supervision Authority in Poland and the Bank of Lithuania in 2018.   As part of their account information service, they provide banking information and use machine learning solutions to categorize and analyze that information in real time, helping companies make most informed business decisions based on hard data, not guesswork. As part of their proprietary technology, Kontomatik offers their clients additional analytical solutions which include financial risk analysis or transaction labeling, allowing scan behavior patterns and analyzing customer trends.   Their portfolio consists of 100+ customers including loan, factoring and leasing companies; banks; and entities from the e-commerce sector (Kontomatik attracts top brands such as Revolut, Raiffeisen Digital Bank, Experian). In accordance with the one passport rule in the EU, Kontomatik can provide access to account information services in 15 EU countries. Read more about Kontomatik on the website www.kontomatik.com

Company description: RNG Labs International Ltd. is a leading IT audit, security and assurance company, that specializes in audits and certifications in the gaming industry, financial and DLT related audits, cybersecurity and ISO 27001 certification. Finally, RNG Labs is also a one-stop shop for companies that are interested in obtaining ISO 27001 certification, since we can assist clients in meeting all of the framework's requirements through an independent audit and work closely with a number of reputable accreditation firms that then conduct the official certification process.

Name: Joydev
Company description: We Find Platform Solutions Where Others Don't Think to Look JoyDev is a platform innovation lab that discovers breakthrough performance patterns in unexpected places. While the tech industry recycles the same solutions, we've realized that Swiss trains solved microservice coordination in 1902, casinos perfected real-time monitoring before computers existed, and ant colonies demonstrate perfect team self-organization. Our Approach Founded in 2018 after recognizing that every "impossible" platform challenge has already been solved somewhere - just not in technology.  We use our Q-SAIL method to discover these patterns: - Question into unknown unknowns - Sense weak signals across domains - Architect new reality spaces - Inspire others to navigate them - Learn from what emerges Transformations Delivered Our cross-domain patterns have revolutionized: - Automotive: Dealer management platforms for Ford, Jaguar, Land Rover, Kia, Hyundai networks - Mobility: City-wide systems using swarm intelligence - Fintech: Payment architectures with exponential performance gains - Enterprise: Platforms achieving order-of-magnitude improvements Current Research Investigating medieval cathedral building principles for 300-year platform stability and nuclear control room patterns for alert design. The patterns continue to surprise us. Partnership Philosophy We occasionally partner with organizations when signals point to breakthrough potential and exponential - not incremental - change is sought. Based in Romania, operating globally wherever patterns emerge. "Your next platform breakthrough isn't in another tech blog - it's hiding in a completely different world."

Further, ADYFE actively advocates and lobbies in favor of these matters, effectively bridging the gap between Africa and Europe, as well as contributing to Africa's socio-economic development by for instance participating at relevant conferences, including the:  ‚Ä¢ 2018 High-Level Forum Africa-Europe in Vienna, Austria ‚Ä¢ 2018 Forum des Diasporas Africaines in Paris, France ‚Ä¢ 4th Africa-Europe Youth Summit in Abidjan, C√¥te d'Ivoire ‚Ä¢ YPII - 2017 African Union-European Union Youth Plug-In Initiative in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia & Brussels, Belgium ADYFE promotes Youth entrepreneurship as means of contributing to an inclusive and sustainable economic development in Africa by connecting and supporting stakeholders from different fields (including aspiring and established entrepreneurs, investors, eco-system enablers, politicians and experts from international organizations). The yearly forum is organized under the AcceleratedAfricaConference+ brand in partnership with the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), the Austrian Development Agency (ADA) and the Austria Federal Economic Chamber (WKO) at the UN in Vienna, Austria. As of 2019, seven editions have taken place. The focus changes on a yearly basis: ‚Ä¢ 2018: "From Entrepreneur to CEO: Channeling the Power of the Diaspora" ‚Ä¢ 2017: "Sharpening the Entrepreneurial Mindset by providing FinTech Solutions and fostering South-South, North-South & Triangular cooperation" During the summit, the main activities include a entrepreneurship pitch competition, as well as Diaspora business talks (testimonials from successful entrepreneurs) and training for aspiring entrepreneurs and startups.

This unique value proposition is based on the combination of the following product innovations: - Web-based restaurant dashboard and menu Every person owning a mobile phone with a web-browser (i.e., Safari, Google Chrome, etc.) can access a web-based restaurant dashboard, using a unique QR-code dedicated to their table. Name: Viisi Labs
Company description: Viisi Labs wants to change the world of insurance and finance, by making it better, more sustainable and long term oriented. We do this by founding, incubating and growing sustainable Insurtech and Fintech companies. In Insurtech we focus on protecting standards of living, on essential risks like disability or health, in Fintech we focus on realising dreams, like owning a home (mortgage), funding a company etcetera. We are also very interested in building alternative ways of financing, like crowdfunding, peer-to-peer- or marketplace-lending.  By focussing on real customer needs we create more sustainable value. As our roots are in sustainable financial planning, we believe that business models involving consumer credit and faster trading are not helpful for customers to reach their life goals. And therefore we do not support these kinds of business models. Our main geographical focus is Switzerland, Germany and the Netherlands. We are always open to discuss collaborations and new opportunities. Please feel free to contact Tom van der Lubbe at tom.vanderlubbe@viisi.com

Name: Satoshi Capital
Company description: We're a startup FinTech company which will be providing financial services to investors.  We want to contribute to the future of money and push society forward. We envision a cashless digital future for money which is decentralized and secure. Our goal is to create a way for investors to gain exposure to cryptocurrency with the ease and economy of investing in a regular fund. We will create a cryptocurrency fund to create value for our investors by investing in the cryptocurrency market.  Our investors will be able to sign up and start investing in a matter of minutes with a mobile first experience.  We want to keep our users happy by providing them with a high return on their investments. Our aim is to achieve exceptional fund performance and have personalized customer support available at all times. Investors will be paid out frequently and whenever they please. Gamification will lead to a better customer experience and users will get rewarded for their loyalty. We value trust a lot. We believe trust in our fund is very important. We will be transparent and do everything we can to create and maintain trust in our fund.

Name: Startup Crash Test
Company description: The Startup Crash Test project is a tool aimed at building connections and developing tech community. It is valuable for the community leaders and those who cultivate the entrepreneurial culture within the city. The first SCT was held in Kyiv in 2008 and was organized by a committee that included Denis Dovgopoliy, Nikolay Savin, Maxim Shkolnick, Dmitri Lisitski, Vladimir Pavlov, and Dmitri Popov. Startup Crash Test has become a platform for the early¬≠ stage development of the Kyiv startup community. Startup Crash Test project is a free international franchise with 12 partner cities,including Milan, Kyiv, London, Berlin, Moscow. Over the last year, we conducted 55 events gathering 2200 attendees, 165 founders presented their projects for the first time. Opened 5 autonomous areas: innovation in the agri-business, law and public data, fintech, ad&marketing tech, automotive and gamedev. Startup Crash Test is an event aimed at ‚Äústress testing‚Äù the market strategies, business models, distribution, roadmaps, etc. of technology startups. This event is designed to offer entrepreneurs a platform to tell about your project to other entrepreneurs, to receive feedback from an audience, to find partners, and to develop your network.  The goal ‚Äì to present new projects, technologies, and business models. The task ‚Äì is not bring out the best, to help do better on- going projects. Together we are looking for the solution to the problem. We discuss new ideas by using collective intelligence and expertise. We combine the experience of entrepreneurs, developers, and sector regulators.  In general, the requirements for startups: - to be created not more than 1.5 year ago; - MVP, prototype or first small sales; - some beginning investments, could be own startup money; - desire to pitch, answer on questions and be open for collaboration. Structure of the event: Content part  includes speaker and 3 startups. Afterwards, there is time for networking.

Name: CargoX
Company description: CargoX is one of the leading providers of blockchain-based electronic trade document solutions, introducing trust in the digital economy. The CargoX Platform for Blockchain Data Transfer (BDT) makes it possible to create, sign and transfer electronic trade documents, reducing manual paperwork and administrative burdens. The platform was developed with the goal of digitalising bills of lading and other electronic trade documents, and facilitated the first blockchain-based electronic bill of lading being used in practice. Since achieving that milestone, CargoX has added support for several types of electronic bills of lading, and was the first public blockchain-based eBL provider to receive approval from International Group of P&I Clubs (IGP&I). It has also been collaborating on developing future standards with major shipping & logistics organisations, including DCSA and FIATA, as well as SWIFT and the International Chamber of Commerce. The CargoX Platform for BDT is integrated as a blockchain document transfer gateway with the Egyptian single window system for foreign trade that includes advance cargo information (ACI). CargoX is currently collaborating on implementing customs and trade systems in Uganda and Abu Dhabi, as well as working on the fintech space with banks on new blockchain-based solutions. The CargoX Platform is used by 125,000 businesses and organisations worldwide. They used it to process more than 7 million electronic documents.

Name: Digital Embassy
Company description: Digital Embassy is the international union of global digital technologies. Digital Embassy is the umbrella organisation of 16 international digital technology federations: 3D Printing Federation, AI Artificial Intelligence Federation, AR Augmented Reality Federation, Big Data Federation, Blockchain Federation, Cloud Computing Federation, CryptoCurrency Federation, CyberSecurity Federation, Drones Federation, FinTech Federation, ICO (Initial Coins Offering) Federation, IoT Federation, Quantum Computing Federation, RegTech Federation, Robotics Federation, and VR Virtual Reality Federation. Every person within the Digital Embassy is representing the digital asset industry on a global scale and is a Digital Ambassador by definition. Each federation has its own small group of C-level decision makers, operational staff, and technical staff. Also, each federation has several special interest groups, allowing for cross-federation and cross-market interaction. This enables for example a UK insurance company in the Blockchain Federation to learn from a Dutch contact-centre‚Äôs experience with Chatbots in the AI Federation. Any federation membership allows for free access to all of the other federations, ensuring comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of digital technologies at the most competitive price in the industry.

Name: St. Stephan Capital Partners GmbH
Company description: St. Stephan Capital Partners is an independent asset manager and family office located in Vienna, Austria. We strive to offer a holistic and opportunistic investment strategy to our partners and investors.  Our team of investment professionals takes a structured approach to analysis, with expertise in corporate finance, M&A, wealth management, and alternative investments.

Name: BankenScore
Company description: BankenScore is the SME scoring platform of the future. We partner with all relevant players when it comes to creditscoring: SMBs, Banks and Creditbureaus. BankenScore provides the only platform in Europe: - to check and understand your SME credit rating for free. - to update credit information and correct it if necessary. - to get matching score-based financial offers. BankenScore has set itself the goal of helping smaller entrepreneurs to understand their creditscore and its relevance in daily business. In partnership with various credit-bureaus we help entrepreneurs to understand what information is stored about them with credit bureaus and what they need to do to be optimally prepared to conduct successful credit counseling with banks. Our goal is for self-employed people and entrepreneurs to spend less time researching loan offers and to be able to immediately compare and apply for suitable offers. BankenScore cooperates with various fintechs and banks, to provide matching financial offers and thereby reduce inefficiencies in the overall lending process. Banks profit from previously analysed and pre-scored company information and faster credit decisions, thereby reducing marketing- and salescost.

Name: OwnCity

Company description: I would like to take this opportunity to explain to you how the Africa Business Tour project began.  Why Africa Business Tour and Synergy? Africa Business Tour, started one evening, asking me how I could help people in Africa with my expertise? When I came up with the vision for the project that aims to provide strategic support to African entrepreneurs and fintechs who have made entrepreneurial decisions. I was so excited to implement the project by taking action after after thinking about it for a short period of time. When I made the first Africa Business Tour to Cameroon in 2022, where I met several entrepreneurs in the technology and other sectors, the feedback I received confirmed my vision that there is a need for my experience and network to help African entrepreneurs shine. I took the opportunity to challenge them to raise the level of their business by taking part in international events and competitions, which they did, and for the first time there were many candidates from Cameroon who took part in #Catapult Africa in #Luxembourg in 2022. In 2023 the Catapult Africa winner was Virginie POUNA NGOMI from COVA Cameroon, whom I also encouraged to take part in this event.  I'm very proud of all the African entrepreneurs who struggle every day to get ahead, and I'm also grateful for my contribution to the development of fintech in Africa and worldwide. For me, this project is multi-dimensional : 1) to share my entrepreneurial experience,  2) to motivate and educate african entrepreneurs,  3) to offer investors the opportunity to discover beautiful projects "Made in Africa" in Luxembourg and Europe. TIME TO GIVE BACK!  The Africa Business Tour, is a project whose goal is to accompany and encourage African entrepreneurs and project holders to better structure their projects and find adequate financing in order to realize them and thus contribute to the development of Africa.

Name: Eliacin
Company description: Eliacin is a consultancy & investment boutique dedicated to Real Estate innovation, crossing its real estate experience with the most advanced trends in the PropTech field. Made in Luxembourg. Eliacin, through its dedicated vehicle Erisa SA , partners with a couple of promising start-up (e.g. equity, corporate structuring, business development). The PropTech domain is the transformation of the real estate market, thanks to new technologies and new players, offering innovative solutions changing the way the business used to be done. According to  the recent report drew up by the Oxford University, PropTech 3.0: the future of Real Estate (4.2017), PropTech embraces mainly 3 key verticals: -	Smart Real Estate encompasses technology-based platforms which facilitate the operation and management of real estate assets. This sector supports real estate asset, property and facilities management.  -	The Shared Economy includes technology-based platforms which facilitate the use of real estate assets. This sector supports the real estate occupier markets. -	Real Estate FinTech covers technology-based platforms, which facilitate the trading of real estate asset ownership. This sector supports the real estate capital markets.  Numerous  start-ups address now the various pain points in this industry, and investors are catching this drift, as investment figures speak from themselves. Our current portfolio : Cognityk Luxembourg (Lu) Cognityk (Fr) Climate Action Blockchain (Lu) Flatsy (Fr) HomExperts (Lu) Iris (Ma) Lici (Fr) Spallian (Fr) Syment SAS (Fr) SYD.Cloud (Lu) The Broker Certificate (Lu) Virtual Comedy (Ma) Vivoka (Fr) Yatta development (Lu) Smartbeam (B)

Name: Sunlit Ventures
Company description: Sunlit Ventures is founded by a group of Stripe alumni dedicated to investing in and advising founders who are building solutions for financial inclusion in the digital economy. We specialize in pre-seed, seed, and Series A investments in infrastructure solutions for the fintech industry (API, Blockchain, AI), with a particular focus on platforms designed for developers. Our initial target markets include Europe (Southern countries), Latam, Africa (Nigeria) and the Middle East (mainly the UAE and Saudi Arabia), addressing the pressing need for fintech infrastructure solutions and promoting financial inclusion. We invest equally in companies originating from these markets, those developing solutions for these markets, and those seeking to expand into these markets. With over 20 years of combined expertise in investing and fostering the growth of fintech startups worldwide, we offer customized support and strategic direction to help overcome growth hurdles, especially in developing impactful Go-to-Market strategies. We operate with our own capital. We typically get involved directly into the operations of our customers (both portfolio companies or external clients), sharing our direct experience in building and scaling fintech unicorns.

Name: AlgoStrata
Company description: AlgoStrata is a B2B FinTech startup based in Copenhagen which develops revolutionary software for asset allocation. We, the founding team behind AlgoStrata, have our roots anchored in the academic environment and have several years of experience within asset allocation and software development. We are building an API based platform for portfolio construction, analysis and investment advice, focusing on active index allocation. We take advantage of our connection to the academic environment by using the latest research within the fields of data science and quantitative finance to build unique features in our system. Our software covers several aspects of the investment process; from onboarding costumers, building and testing investment strategies, execution towards monitoring and reporting. It helps our clients to run their business in a new, innovative way, better and faster than before. This makes our clients more efficient and profitable and increase their customer satisfaction. We believe that ‚Äúone size fits all‚Äù software does not exist in our industry, hence our platform is built on top of RESTful API‚Äôs which allows several types customers to build their own user experience on top of our calculation engine.  Open Source We believe that research results should be made easily available to the public. By starting an open source project, in parallel to AlgoStrata, we invite students, researchers and investment specialists to freely use the library of methods and contribute to its growth. Bridging the gab  We believe that a close collaboration between academia and industry generates innovation and offers the society at large great value. By creating AlgoStrata we aim at bridging the gap between investment researchers and fund managers or investment specialists. We are currently looking for partners, investors and co-creators. Feel free to reach out: contact@AlgoStrata.com

Our services: - Software development - Software development and IT consulting - Analysis and design of information systems - New product development - Organisational change consulting - Software & IT Management consulting - Software & Security auditing - Product management consulting What does New Thread mean? In computer science a thread represents the smallest unit of a running process. In the context of an operating system, it can be seen as the execution of a piece of code within a running process. Therefore multiple threads can be executed by a single instance of a process. Essentially speaking: A thread is the most atomic unit of code execution. In the context of central processing units, a thread represents a virtual instance of a core that executes the given instructions from a running process/or OS.
